item.title: FTSE 100 Rises as ABF Gains; Imperial Brands, Vodafone Fall
item.description: The FTSE 100 Index rose 0.3% in early trading, as gains for Associated British Foods offset losses for Vodafone and Imperial Brands.

item.title: Telecom Italia Hit as CDP Reportedly Pulls Bid
item.description: Telecom Italia shares fell after Bloomberg reported that Italian state lender CDP planned to pull out of the bidding process for the teleco’s fixed-network assets.

item.title: China's Youth Unemployment Tops 20% Amid Signs of Stalling Recovery
item.description: China’s youth unemployment rate rose above 20% for the first time since Beijing began tracking the data five years ago.

item.title: Sterling Falls as Weaker Labor Data Could Dent Chances of June Rate Rise
item.description: Sterling fell after data showed the U.K. jobless rate unexpectedly edged up in the first quarter, while wage growth was slightly below forecasts, with the figures increasing the possibility the BOE could pause raising rates, ING said.

item.title: Crude Oil Inches Lower Amid Demand Worries
item.description: Crude prices edged lower after Chinese industrial output data disappointed, although April’s refining numbers pointed to more positive signs of demand, ING said.

item.title: Metals Slip Amid China Economy Weakness
item.description: Base metals and gold were moving lower as worries over demand lingered, with data showing China’s economy was struggling to recover from the effects of Covid-19.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Ease as Market Focus Is on Economic Data
item.description: Eurozone 10-year bond yields were trading lower at the open, with macroeconomic indicators likely an increasing market factor in coming days and weeks, with views about a looming U.S. recession varying widely, Commerzbank said.

item.title: Bouygues Confirms Outlook After First-Quarter Loss
item.description: Bouygues confirmed it was targeting sales this year close to the level of 2022 and an increase in operating profit, after it reported an operating loss of €14 million in the first quarter

item.title: Imperial Brands Sticks to Guidance After Solid First Half
item.description: Imperial Brands said it was on track to meet its full-year guidance as it posted a 28% rise in operating profit and stable revenue for the first half of fiscal 2023.

item.title: Vodafone Forecasts Flat Profits; to Cut Jobs
item.description: Vodafone said it expected adjusted Ebitda to be flat at around €13.3 billion this year, as it announced plans to cut 11,000 jobs over three years, admitting that its performance had not been good enough.

item.title: UK Unemployment Rate, Pay Growth Tick Up
item.description: The U.K. unemployment rate stood at 3.9% in the first quarter of 2023, slightly higher than expectations, while pay growth continued to rise, reflecting a little slacking in the labor market and continuing pressures on employers to raise wages.

item.title: 3M said it fired company president Michael Vale, citing inappropriate personal conduct and violation of company policy by the longtime executive.
item.description: 3M said it fired company president Michael Vale, citing inappropriate personal conduct and violation of company policy by the longtime executive.

item.title: The Biden administration is considering creating a government-run alternative to TurboTax and H&R Block, drawing resistance from Republicans and companies fearing a loss of business.
item.description: The Biden administration is considering creating a government-run alternative to TurboTax and H&R Block, drawing resistance from Republicans and companies fearing a loss of business.

item.title: Chinese authorities said they sentenced a U.S. citizen to life in prison on espionage charges, in a case that could further strain relations between Beijing and the U.S.
item.description: Chinese authorities said they sentenced a U.S. citizen to life in prison on espionage charges, in a case that could further strain relations between Beijing and the U.S.

item.title: The USDA is considering banning flavored milk in elementary and middle schools when it adopts new standards for school meals.
item.description: The USDA is considering banning flavored milk in elementary and middle schools when it adopts new standards for school meals.

item.title: Zelensky held talks in London with British Prime Minister Sunak in the latest stop on a tour of European capitals aimed at bolstering allied military support for Ukraine.
item.description: Zelensky held talks in London with British Prime Minister Sunak in the latest stop on a tour of European capitals aimed at bolstering allied military support for Ukraine.

item.title: Turkey will hold a runoff presidential election later this month, officials said, with President Erdogan emerging from this weekend's polls with a surprise advantage over his main challenger.
item.description: Turkey will hold a runoff presidential election later this month, officials said, with President Erdogan emerging from this weekend’s polls with a surprise advantage over his main challenger.

item.title: Special counsel Durham issued a highly critical report on how the FBI handled allegations linking Trump to Russia in 2016, ending four years of work after having lost the two criminal cases he took to trial.
item.description: Special counsel Durham issued a highly critical report on how the FBI handled allegations linking Trump to Russia in 2016, ending four years of work after having lost the two criminal cases he took to trial.

item.title: Ukrainian commanders say that recent military advances around Bakhmut are achieving the goal of engaging and exhausting Russian forces as Kyiv prepares to launch an offensive elsewhere.
item.description: Ukrainian commanders say that recent military advances around Bakhmut are achieving the goal of engaging and exhausting Russian forces as Kyiv prepares to launch an offensive elsewhere.

item.title: U.S. stocks posted gains as investors monitored debt-ceiling talks, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials rising 0.3%, 0.7% and 0.1%, respectively.
item.description: U.S. stocks posted gains as investors monitored debt-ceiling talks, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials rising 0.3%, 0.7% and 0.1%, respectively.
